intro: Scrophularia scorodonia var. papillaris, commonly known as the wrinkled figwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough, papillate surface, which gives it its common name. Its flowers are usually pale purple to pink, arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
